intro: Josephia plumosa, commonly known as the silky broom, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. Its leaves are finely divided, giving it a soft, fluffy appearance, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Josephia plumosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
